turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Hey, come on, it's quiet now. We can- we can start again.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: What-

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: My head is throbbing.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Oh, you got a headache!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I have a headache.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Bad?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Oswald and ghosts.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Jesus!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Well, I'm-I'm gonna take another in a series of cold showers.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Man, that's great. That's just great.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: You catch Dylan?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Me? No, no. I-I couldn't make it that ni- My-my raccoon had hepatitis.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: You have a raccoon?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Tsch, a few.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: The only word for this is trans- plendid. It's trans-plendid.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I can think of another word.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: He's God! I mean, this man is God! He's got millions of followers who would crawl all the way across the world just to touch the hem of his garment.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Really? It must be a tremendous hem.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: I'm a Rosicrucian myself.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Are you?

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I can't get with any religion that advertises in Popular Mechanics. Look-  there's God coming outta the men's room.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: It's unbelievably trans-plendid! I was at the Stones concert in Altamount when they killed that guy, remember?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah, were yuh? I was-I was at an Alice Cooper thing where six people were rushed to the hospital with bad vibes.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: I hope you don't mind that I took so long to finish.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Oh, no, no, don't be... tsch... don't be silly. You know,  I'm startin' it-I'm startin' to get some feeling back in my jaw now.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: Oh, sex with you is really a kafkaesque experience.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Oh, tsch, thank you. H'm.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: I mean that as a compliment.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I think-I think there's too much burden placed on the orgasm, you know, to make up for empty areas in life.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: Who said that?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Uh, oh, I don't know. It might have been Leopold and Loeb.  Hello. Oh, hi... Uh, no, what-what's the matter? What-what-what? You sound terrible... No, what- Sure I- Whatta yuh what kind of an emergency?... No, well, stay there. Stay there, I'll come over right now. I'll come over right now.  Just stay there, I'll come right over.

turns.speaker: MAN IN LINE
turns.text: You know, it must need to have had its leading from one thought to another. You know what I'm talking about?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: He's screaming his opinions in my ear.

turns.speaker: MAN IN LINE
turns.text: Like all that Juliet of the Spirits or Satyricon, I found it incredibly... indulgent. You know, he really is. He's one of the most indulgent film makers. He really is-

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Key word here is "indulgent."

turns.speaker: MAN IN LINE
turns.text: without getting... well, let's put it this way...

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: What are you depressed about?

turns.speaker: MAN IN LINE
turns.text: It's like Samuel Beckett, you know- I admire the technique but he doesn't... he doesn't hit me on a gut level.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I'd like to hit this guy on a gut level.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Probably on their first date, right?

turns.speaker: MAN IN LINE
turns.text: It's a narrow view.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Probably met by answering an ad in the New York Review of Books. "Thirtyish academic wishes to meet woman who's interested in Mozart, James Joyce and sodomy."  Whatta you mean, our sexual problem?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I never read that. That was-that was Henry James, right? Novel, uh, the sequel to Turn of the Screw? My Sexual...

turns.speaker: MAN IN LINE
turns.text: It's the influence of television. Yeah, now Marshall McLuhan deals with it in terms of it being a-a high, uh, high intensity, you understand?  A hot medium... as opposed to a...

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: What I wouldn't give for a large sock o' horse manure.

turns.speaker: MAN IN LINE
turns.text: ...as opposed to a print...

turns.speaker: MAN IN LINE
turns.text: Wait a minute, why can't I give my opinion? It's a free country!

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I mean, d- He can give you- Do you hafta give it so loud? I mean, aren't you ashamed to pontificate like that? And- and the funny part of it is, M- Marshall McLuhan, you don't know anything about Marshall McLuhan's... work!

turns.speaker: MAN IN LINE
turns.text: Wait a minute! Really? Really? I happen to teach a class at Columbia called "TV Media and Culture"! So I think that my insights into Mr. McLuhan- well, have a great deal of validity.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Oh, do yuh?

turns.speaker: MAN IN LINE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Well, that's funny, because I happen to have Mr. McLuhan right here. So... so, here, just let me- I mean, all right. Come over here... a second.

turns.speaker: MAN IN LINE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Tell him.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Thank you very much. It's a pleasure.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: This is, uh, Shawn, and, uh... Bob and Petronia.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: This is a great house, really. Everything. Saunas, Jacuzzis, three tennis courts. You know who the original owners were? Nelson Eddy, then Legs Diamond. Then you know who lived here?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Trigger.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Charlie Chaplin.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Right before his un-American thing.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Uh, you guys are still-uh, you're still New Yorkers.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah, I love it there.

turns.speaker: GIRL DATE
turns.text: What are you making such a big deal about?  They're only lobsters. Look, you're a grown man, you know how to pick up a lobster.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I'm not myself since I stopped smoking.

turns.speaker: GIRL DATE
turns.text: Oh, when'd you quit smoking?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Sixteen years ago.

turns.speaker: GIRL DATE
turns.text: Whatta you mean?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Mean?

turns.speaker: GIRL DATE
turns.text: You stopped smoking sixteen years ago, is that what you said? Oh, I-I don't understand. Are you joking, or what?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Officer, I know what you're gonna say. I'm-I'm not a great driver, you know, I-I have some problems with- with-with-

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: May I see your license, please?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Sure.  just don't-don't get angry, you know what I mean? 'Cause I-I have - I have my-my license here. You know, it's a rented car. And I've...

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Don't give me your life story  just pick up the license.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Pick up the license. You have to ask nicely 'cause I've had an extremely rough day. You know, my girl friend-

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Just give me the license, please.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Since you put it that way.  It's hard for me to refuse.  ...have a, I have a terrific problem with authority, you know. I'm... it's not your fault. Don't take it personal.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I distinctly heard it. He muttered under his breath, "Jew."

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: You're crazy!

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: No, I'm not. We were walking off the tennis court, and you know, he was there and me and his wife, and he looked at her and then they both looked at me, and under his breath he said, "Jew."

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Alvy, you're a total paranoid.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Wh- How am I a paran-? Well, I pick up on those kind o' things. You know, I was having lunch with some guys from NBC, so I said... uh, "Did you eat yet or what?" and Tom Christie said, "No, didchoo?" Not, did you, didchoo eat? Jew? No, not did you eat, but Jew eat? Jew. You get it? Jew eat?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Ah, Max, you, uh...

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Stop calling me Max.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Why, Max? It's a good name for you. Max, you see conspiracies in everything.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: No, I don't! You know, I was in a record store. Listen to this- so I know there's this big tall blond crew-cutted guy and he's lookin' at me in a funny way and smiling and he's saying, "Yes, we have a sale this week on Wagner." Wagner, Max, Wagner- so I know what he's really tryin' to tell me very significantly Wagner.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Right, Max. California, Max.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Let's get the hell outta this crazy city.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Forget it, Max.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: We move to sunny L.A. All of show business is out there, Max.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: No, I cannot. You keep bringing it up, but I don't wanna live in a city where the only cultural advantage is that you can make a right turn on a red light.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Right, Max, forget it. Aren't you gonna be late for meeting Annie?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I'm gonna meet her in front of the Beekman. I think I have a few minutes left. Right?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Max, my serve is gonna send yuh to the showers-

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Right, right, so g-get back to what we were discussing, the failure of the country to get behind New York City is-is anti-Semitism.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Max, the city is terribly worried.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: But the- I'm not discussing politics or economics. This is foreskin.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: No, no, no, Max, that's a very convenient out. Every time some group disagrees with you it's because of anti-Semitism.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Don't you see? The rest of the country looks upon New York like we're-we're left-wing Communist, Jewish, homosexual, pornographers. I think of us that way, sometimes, and I-I live here.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Max, if we lived in California, we could play outdoors every day, in the sun.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Sun is bad for yuh. Everything our parents said was good is bad. Sun, milk, red meat, college...

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Yeah, watch the road!

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: You'll total the whole car.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah, the neighborhood's gonna be great.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: We can show her the schoolyard.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Right. I was a great athlete. Tell her, Max, I was the best, I was all schoolyard.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Yes, I remember.  He was all schoolyard. They threw him a football once, he tried to dribble it.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah, well, I used to lose my glasses a lot.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I have some very good memories there.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: What kind of good memories, Max? Your mother and father fighting all the time.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah, and always over the most ridiculous things.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Right-well, Santa Claus will have sunstroke.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Max, there's no crime, there's no mugging.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: There's no economic crime, you know, but there's-there's ritual, religious- cult murders, you know, there's wheat- germ killers out here.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: While you're out here, Max, I want you to see some of my TV show. And we're invited to a big Christmas party.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Look, now, Charlie, give me a big laugh here.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Do you realize how immoral this all is?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Max, I've got a hit series.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah, I know; but you're adding fake laughs.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Give me a tremendous laugh here, Charlie.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Look, uh...

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: We do the show live in front of an audience.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Great, but nobody laughs at it 'cause your jokes aren't funny.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Yeah, well, that's why this machine is dynamite.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I don't know, I just got-I got very dizzy...  I feel dizzy, Max.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Well, sit down.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Oh, Jesus.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: You all right?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I don't know, I mean, I-

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: You wanna lie down?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: No, no-my, you know, my stomach felt queasy all morning. I just started getting...

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: How about a ginger ale?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Oh, Max... no, I maybe I better lie down.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: You like this house, Max?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: M'hm.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: I even brought a road map to get us to the bathroom.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Whee, you shoulda told me it was Tony Lacey's party.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: What difference does that make?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I think he has a little thing for Annie.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Oh, no, no, that's bullshit, Max. He goes with that girl over there.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: The one with the V.P.L.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: V.P.L.?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Visible panty line. Max, she is gorgeous.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah, she's a ten, Max, and that's great for you because you're-you're used to twos, aren't you?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: There are no twos, Max.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah, you're used to the kind with the- with the shopping bags walking through Central Park with the surgical masks on muttering.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: M'hm.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: And... uh-

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: How do you like this couple, Max?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: And I think they just came back from Masters and Johnson.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah, intensive care ward.  My God-hey, Max, I think she's... I think she's giving me the eye.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: If she comes over here, Max, my brain is going to turn into guacamole.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I'll handle it. I'll handle it. Hi.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Oh, he-he didn't say anything.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: No, no, I came out here to get some shock therapy, but there was an energy crisis, so I... He's my-my food taster. Have you two met?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Hi. How do you do.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Hey, you guys are wearin' white. It must be in the stars.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Yeah. Right.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Uri Geller must be on the premises someplace.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: We're gonna operate together.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Imagine my surprise when I got your call, Max.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah. I had the feeling that I got you at a bad moment. You know, I heard high-pitched squealing.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Twins, Max. Sixteen-year-olds. Can you imagine the mathematical possibilities?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: You're an actor, Max. You should be doing Shakespeare in the Park.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Oh, I did Shakespeare in the Park, Max. I got mugged. I was playing Richard the Second and two guys with leather jackets stole my leotard.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Max, are we driving through plutonium?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Keeps out the alpha rays, Max. You don't get old.

turns.speaker: ALVY'S FATHER
turns.text: Let 'im drop dead! Who needs his business?!

turns.speaker: ALVY'S MOTHER
turns.text: His wife has diabetes!

turns.speaker: ALVY'S FATHER
turns.text: Di-diabetes? Is that any excuse? Diabetes?

turns.speaker: ALVY'S FATHER
turns.text: You fired the cleaning woman?

turns.speaker: ALVY'S MOTHER
turns.text: She was stealing.

turns.speaker: ALVY'S FATHER
turns.text: But she's colored.

turns.speaker: ALVY'S MOTHER
turns.text: SO?

turns.speaker: ALVY'S FATHER
turns.text: So the colored have enough trouble.

turns.speaker: ALVY'S MOTHER
turns.text: She was going through my pocketbook!

turns.speaker: ALVY'S FATHER
turns.text: They're persecuted enough!

turns.speaker: ALVY'S MOTHER
turns.text: Who's persecuting? She stole!

turns.speaker: ALVY'S FATHER
turns.text: All right-so we can afford it.

turns.speaker: ALVY'S MOTHER
turns.text: How can we afford it? On your pay? What if she steals more?

turns.speaker: ALVY'S FATHER
turns.text: She's a colored woman, from Harlem!

turns.speaker: ALVY'S VOICE
turns.text: Dennis-right, uh, uh... local kid probably, would meetcha in front of the movie house on Saturday night.

turns.speaker: ANNIE'S VOICE
turns.text: Oh, God, you should've seen what I looked like then.

turns.speaker: ALVY'S VOICE
turns.text: Oh, I can imagine. P-p-probably the wife of an astronaut.

turns.speaker: ANNIE'S VOICE
turns.text: Then there was Jerry, the actor.

turns.speaker: ALVY'S VOICE
turns.text: Look at you, you-you're such a clown.

turns.speaker: ANNIE'S VOICE
turns.text: I look pretty.

turns.speaker: ALVY'S VOICE
turns.text: Well, yeah, you always look pretty, but that guy with you...

turns.speaker: ALVY'S VOICE
turns.text: Heavy! Eaten by some squirrels.

turns.speaker: ANNIE'S VOICE
turns.text: Hey, listen-I mean, he was a terrific actor, and look at him, he's neat- looking and he was emotional... Y- hey, I don't think you like emotion too much.

turns.speaker: ANNIE'S VOICE-OVER
turns.text: That was fun. I don't think California is bad at all. It's a drag coming home.

turns.speaker: ALVY'S VOICE-OVER
turns.text: Lotta beautiful women. It was fun to flirt.

turns.speaker: ANNIE'S VOICE-OVER
turns.text: I have to face facts. I-I adore Alvy, but our relationship doesn't seem to work anymore.

turns.speaker: ALVY'S VOICE-OVER
turns.text: I'll have the usual trouble with Annie in bed tonight. Whatta I need this?

turns.speaker: ANNIE'S VOICE-OVER
turns.text: If only I had the nerve to break up, but it would really hurt him.

turns.speaker: ALVY'S VOICE-OVER
turns.text: If only I didn't feel guilty asking Annie to move out. It'd probably wreck her. But I should be honest.

turns.speaker: MOM HALL
turns.text: We went over to the swap meet. Annie, Gram and I. Got some nice picture frames.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: We really had a good time.

turns.speaker: MOM HALL
turns.text: Oh, that Randolph Hunt. You remember Randy Hunt, Annie. He was in the choir with you.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh, yes, yes.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh, yes, that's right. Did you see the new play?

turns.speaker: MOM HALL
turns.text: Oh, you remember her, Annie.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Yes, I do.

turns.speaker: MOM HALL
turns.text: Now, don't let it be so long, now.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MOM HALL
turns.text: Oh, he's adorable, Annie.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You think so? Do you really?

turns.speaker: MOM HALL
turns.text: We're going to take them to the airport.

turns.speaker: MOM HALL
turns.text: M'mmm.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I just have time to get the, uh-

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Hi, I'm-I'm Tony Lacey.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Well, hi!

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Uh, we just wanted to stop by and say that we really enjoyed your sets.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh, yeah, really, oh!

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: I though it was... very musical, and I liked it a lot.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh, neat... oh, that's very nice, gosh, thanks a lot.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Are you... are you recording? Or do- Are you with any label now?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: No, no, no, not at all.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Uh, well, I'd like to talk to you about that sometime, if you get a chance.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh. What about?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: ...of possibly working together.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Well, hey, that's, that's nice. Uh. Oh, listen, this is, uh, Alvy Singer. Do you know Alvy? Uh... and... uh... Tony Lacey.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: No, I don't-I don't know, but I-I know your work. I'm a big fan of yours.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Uh... w-we're going back to the Pierre. We're staying at the Pierre... and we're gonna meet Jack and Angelica, and have a drink there, and... if you'd like to come, uh, we'd love to have you.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: And we could just sit and talk... nothing. Uh, not a big deal, it's just relax, just be very mellow.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Oh, well, I-if it's inconvenient, eh, we can't do it now... that's fine, too. W-w-w-we'll do it another time.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Hey-

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Maybe if you're on the Coast, we'll get together and... and we'll meet there.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: It was a wonderful set.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh, gosh.

turns.speaker: TONY
